title: Nearly 4 GW of solar capacity in Rajasthan hit by transmission constraints
content: Solar power generation in Rajasthan has been severely hit as over 4.3 GW of solar capacity is being fully curtailed during daytime due to transmission shortages, leaving power plants unable to evacuate electricity to the grid and putting projects worth nearly ‚Çπ20,000 crore at risk, according to industry sources

title: BJP-led NDA makes it big in Thripunithura
content: The party served as the principal Opposition in the temple town, dislodging the UDF in the last two terms since 2015. It wins 21 seats in the polls to stake claim to power in the 53-member civic body. The¬†LDF¬†bags 20 seats and the Congress-led front 12 seats.

title: Wanted sons, unwanted daughters: sex determination takes digital turn
content: India‚Äôs gender preference still exists in homes, except that the conversations are now mostly behind closed doors and in online spaces. title: CM, leaders all praise for Horatti, Chairman of Council felicitated for completing 45 years as MLC
content: Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Basavaraj Horatti, who has already created a record for his eighth successive win from teachers‚Äô constituency, was given a grand and warm felicitation by leaders of various political parties including chief minister Siddaramaiah at Nehru Stadium in Hubballi on Saturday in the presence of thousands of teachers and well wishers from different walks of life.

title: Mines Dept. issues show-cause notice to ACC Ltd. on  limestone leases
content: Company given two weeks time to file its reply on why the leases granted to it in 2019-24, in purported violation of norms laid down by the Central government, should not be cancelled

title: UDF breaches LDF citadels in Kozhikode, NDA makes gains in urban areas
content: Though the¬†LDF¬†just managed to retain power in the 76-member¬†Kozhikode¬†Corporation council and won eight of the 12 block panchayats, it narrowly lost the district panchayat and surrendered its supremacy in¬†grama¬†panchayats to the UDF

title: BJP leaders says NDA now a key force in bipolar Kerala politics

title: 3.9 magnitude tremor hits Kutch district of Gujarat, no damage reported
content: This is the fifth tremor of magnitude above 3 recorded in Kutch this month; epicentre near Gadhshisha village

title: Source: Colts expected to start Rivers vs. Seattle
content: Philip Rivers, who came out of retirement this week to help the Colts address their void at quarterback, is expected to start Sunday against the Seahawks, a source told ESPN.

title: Cena retires from wrestling after submission loss
content: Before a stunned crowd, John Cena signaled to fans that his time is finally over, tapping out on a sleeper hold from Gunther at "Saturday Night's Main Event."

content: The 49ers placed Brandon Aiyuk on the reserve/left team list on Saturday, likely ending the receiver's tenure in San Francisco.

content: Having a statue in your honor is a mixed bag if you're a legendary soccer player. It can be either a life-affirming blessing or a hideous curse.

content: Sunderland midfielder Noah Sadiki is generating interest from top Premier League clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: BJP Flags Controversial Slogans Ahead Of Congress's 'Vote Theft' Rally
content: The Congress's real objective is to "eliminate" Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the BJP has alleged after some leaders of the main opposition were seen raising controversial slogans at the venue of the Congress's mega rally in Delhi today.

title: 2 Killed, 8 Injured In Shooting During Final Exams At Brown University In US
content: At least two people were killed and eight others were injured after a shooter dressed in black opened fire at Brown University on Saturday. The shooting happened as students were appearing for final exams.

title: Two Held After Reports Of Gunfire At Australia's Bondi Beach
content: Australian police said two people were in custody following reports of multiple gunshots Sunday at Sydney's famed Bondi Beach, urging the public to take shelter.

title: Tension Grips Uttarakhand Town After Man Stabbed To Death During Clash
content: On Friday night, an argument between two groups escalated into a violent clash in which Tushar Sharma was stabbed to death, and his two companions were seriously injured, Udham Singh Nagar Senior Superintendent of Police Manikant Mishra said.

title: 2 More From Bangladesh Get Indian Citizenship Under CAA In Assam
content: Two persons, including a woman, have been granted Indian citizenship under the CAA, taking the count of people receiving it under the Act to four in Assam, their lawyer said.

title: India Ranks 3rd In AI Competitiveness After US And China: Report
content: India has emerged as the world's third most competitive country in artificial intelligence, according to Stanford University's Global AI Vibrancy Tool on Sunday.

title: Air India Crash: 6 Months On, College Hostel Stands As A Haunting Reminder
content: Six months after the AI-171 plane crash, the B J Medical College hostel complex in Ahmedabad stands as a haunting reminder, with its charred walls and burnt trees replacing the once lively chatter of students with an eerie stillness.

content: Charges include Section 121, which deals with voluntarily causing hurt to a public servant or waging war, or attempting or abetting waging war against the government.

title: 'We hid in the dark': How fear & sirens took over Brown University; students narrate 'nightmare'
content: Gunshots erupted at Brown University, sending students into lockdown and triggering a massive manhunt. The attack inside an engineering building resulted in two fatalities and multiple injuries. Authorities released suspect footage, urging the public to report any information as the campus grappled with the sudden violence.

title: Several injured after mass shooting at Sydney‚Äôs Bondi Beach; video captures gunmen opening fire ‚Äî watch
content: Multiple shots were reported at Sydney's Bondi Beach, prompting a large police and emergency response. Authorities have urged the public to avoid the area and take shelter. Two individuals have been taken into custody, and several patients are receiving on-site treatment, with some transported to local hospitals.

title: Fact Check: Is China carrying out a massive military build-up near Arunachal Pradesh? Here's the truth behind viral claim
content: PIB has debunked viral claims of a large-scale Chinese military build-up near Arunachal Pradesh. The government's fact-checking agency clarified that the circulated video depicts a routine exercise by the PLA's 78th Group Army, unrelated to the Indian border. Citizens are urged to verify information from official sources.

title: US‚ÄìChina chip rift: White House AI czar flags rejection of US chips; Nvidia blames overbroad export controls
content: China is reportedly rejecting US-made Nvidia H200 AI chips, favouring domestic alternatives. This move challenges a US strategy to gain market share with less advanced exports. Beijing is also reportedly offering substantial incentives to boost its local chip industry, aiming for greater semiconductor independence and reducing reliance on foreign suppliers.

title: 'Severely damaging': Domestic industry warns against 'zero-duty imports under FTAs'
content: India's domestic copper manufacturing faces severe damage from cheap imports under free trade agreements, according to the Indian Primary Copper Producers Association. The industry body urges the government to implement safeguard duties and quantitative restrictions to protect investments and prevent the erosion of the smelting and downstream manufacturing base.

title: Punjab road tragedy: Couple die as car plunges into drain amid dense fog; were heading for poll duty
content: An English teacher, Jaskaran Singh Bhullar, and his wife, Kanmaljit Kaur, tragically died in a road accident on Sunday morning. While driving to drop his wife for election duty, their car fell into a drain near Sangatpura village in Moga district. Police suspect fog as the cause of the accident, leaving the teacher fraternity in shock.

title: Four hours of waiting, over 1 lakh students in limbo, two outcomes: Why DU‚Äôs exam delay hit them differently
content: Delhi University‚Äôs semester exams descended into chaos after question papers for over 35 subjects reached centres up to four hours late, affecting more than one lakh students. While Honours students were cushioned by additional exam slots, Programme students faced rescheduling and extended uncertainty. The episode exposes how DU‚Äôs exam design distributes disruption unequally.

title: AI vs coders: Ex-Google CEO warns; ‚ÄòThis could be the end for coders like me‚Äô
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt expressed astonishment at AI's rapid progress, particularly its ability to autonomously generate code, admitting his own potential obsolescence. He highlighted AI's significant impact on automating business operations like billing and accounting, predicting artificial general intelligence within three to five years. Schmidt cautioned about the need for human oversight to preserve agency and freedom.

title: Rs 200cr drug bust: Wardha MD racket mastermind ran lab 2km from police station; fixed their CCTVs
content: A computer repairman, Vaibhav Agarwal, was arrested as the mastermind of a Rs200 crore MD drug manufacturing racket in Wardha. He learned drug synthesis online and used his familiarity with police routines to operate a clandestine lab near a police station. DRI busted the unit, seizing 128kg of MD and advanced equipment.

title: When Messi mania turned messy: Chairs thrown, sofa set on fire ‚Äî Inside the Kolkata chaos
content: Lionel Messi's brief 22-minute appearance at Salt Lake stadium ended in chaos as 60,000 disgruntled fans, unable to see the star, erupted in violence. Frustration over poor visibility and absent celebrities led to mayhem, including arson, vandalism, and a police lathi-charge, lasting over an hour.

title: D-Street outlook: What could drive the market this upcoming week? Key cues to watch
content: Indian markets navigated macroeconomic pressures and global uncertainties this week. A weakening rupee was partially offset by a US Federal Reserve rate cut and optimism around India-US trade talks. While foreign investors sold equities, domestic buying provided support. Investors will watch trade developments and key economic data for direction.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 10: Ranveer, Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan starrer crosses Rs 300 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered expectations, crossing the ‚Çπ300 crore mark in its second week. The film, directed by Aditya Dhar, opened strong and maintained impressive momentum, especially with a remarkable ‚Çπ53 crore collection on its second Saturday.  This massive success has left audiences and industry watchers astounded.

title: No relief: Organiser of Messi Kolkata event denied bail; sent to 14-day police custody
content: Football icon Lionel Messi's G.O.A.T India Tour 2025 organiser, Satadru Dutta, was arrested at Kolkata airport and sent to 14 days' police custody. The arrest followed chaos at the Salt Lake Stadium event, which was cut short, disappointing thousands of fans. Dutta denied responsibility for the disruption.

title: Mumbai tops road traffic CO2 emissions/km; Delhi & Bengaluru among nation‚Äôs top 3 ‚Äî key findings
content: Mumbai leads Indian cities in road traffic CO‚ÇÇ emissions per km due to high vehicle density. A new study reveals major metros like Delhi and Bengaluru also show significant NOx and CO pollution. The research, part of the CHETNA project, mapped emissions across 15 cities at a 500-meter resolution.

title: 'Severe plus' AQI in Delhi: 40 stations go 'red'; residents struggle to breathe
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'severe' category with AQI reaching 497, prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management to invoke GRAP Stage IV pollution-control curbs. Residents reported breathing difficulties, while environmentalists criticized GRAP as a reactive, temporary solution to long-term policy failures. Schools are now conducting hybrid classes, and offices are operating at 50% physical strength.

title: Brown University shooting: 1st visuals surface showing gunman; massive manhunt launched
content: The FBI released footage of a suspect in the Brown University shooting that killed two and injured nine. The individual, seen in black, was walking past a traffic light, though their face was not visible. Investigators are still determining how the shooter gained access to the classroom where the incident began.

title: Roars and leaps! Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to fire, Pakistan go wild in celebration - Watch
content: The Pakistan dugout rose to its feet and applauded as Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who had tormented bowlers in the previous match, was sent back early. After completing the catch, Sayyam threw the ball into the air and leapt in celebration, with his teammates rushing in to hug him as Pakistan celebrated a massive early success against their arch-rivals.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India maintain ‚Äòno handshake‚Äô; avoid eye contact with Pakistan
content: At the toss, neither Ayush Mhatre nor Pakistan skipper Farhan Yousaf initiated the customary exchange of pleasantries. After Pakistan won the toss and chose to bowl first, the two captains avoided eye contact, gave their respective interviews, and proceeded to their dressing rooms.

title: Messi event chaos: Organiser stopped from fleeing Kolkata in chartered plane
content: Event organiser Satadru Dutta was arrested at Kolkata airport, preventing him from leaving the city after the chaotic Lionel Messi show at Salt Lake Stadium. Thousands of fans were left disappointed by the aborted programme, with allegations of mismanagement surfacing. Police confirmed investigations are underway into the fiasco.

title: Fact-check: Bronny James baby rumor with Parker Whitfield debunked amid viral hoax
content: A viral X post claimed LeBron James' son Bronny James is expecting a child with girlfriend Parker Whitfield, but the rumor lacks substantiation and is believed to be a diversion. Bronny and Parker, who have been dating since August 2024, are a popular couple, with Bronny expressing his affection for her on Instagram.

title: Dwyane Wade Says ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Miss Him‚Äù in Emotional Tribute to LeBron James
content: Dwyane Wade, reflecting on LeBron James' 23rd NBA season, expresses admiration and a fan's perspective on an impending era's end.  He acknowledges James' elite performance, even as fans call for retirement, and cherishes their shared championship history. Wade also humorously recalls the 'Big Three' introduction, highlighting the immense pressure and difficulty of winning.

title: David and Victoria Beckham net worth 2025: Football, fashion, business
content: Power couple David and Victoria Beckham boast a combined net worth of $900 million in 2025. David's fortune stems from his legendary football career and lucrative endorsements, while Victoria built hers through successful fashion and beauty empires.  Together, they manage valuable brands, support their family, and remain influential figures in global sports and fashion.

title: South Africa: India-origin man among 4 killed in temple collapse; illegal construction cited
content: An under-construction Hindu temple collapsed in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province, killing four people, including an Indian-origin executive. The four-storey structure, built without approved plans, was being expanded when it fell. Rescue operations were hampered by weather, and the number of individuals still trapped remains unclear.

title: Rs 5L murder deal: MP teen hires minors to kill parents; here's what happened
content: A teenager allegedly hired minors for Rs 5 lakh to kill his father and stepmother over a property dispute. The brutal attack resulted in the deaths of his father and a domestic help, while his stepmother was critically injured. The motive stemmed from perceived family and inheritance slights.

title: 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2' box office collections day 2
content: 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2' shows promising box office growth, earning approximately Rs 2.50 crore on its second day. The comedy film saw increasing occupancy throughout Saturday, with night shows being the most popular. Directed by Anukalp Goswami, the movie stars Kapil Sharma and relies on his signature humor for entertainment.

title: Who is R Sreelekha? BJP‚Äôs frontrunner for Thiruvananthapuram mayor
content: Kerala's first woman IPS officer, R Sreelekha, has emerged as a potential candidate for the first BJP Mayor of Thiruvananthapuram after the saffron party's historic win. Sreelekha, who recently joined the BJP, secured a significant victory in the Sasthamangalam ward. The party will decide on the mayoral post.

title: Operation Sagar Bandhu: India boosts connectivity restoration efforts in Sri Lanka; watch
content: India has intensified its aid to Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah, deploying an Engineer Task Force to restore critical infrastructure and providing extensive medical support. The Indian Army is working with Sri Lankan counterparts to rebuild damaged bridges, while Operation Sagar Bandhu delivers essential medicines and humanitarian assistance, underscoring India's commitment to its neighbor's recovery.

title: Man fatally stabbed in clash between two groups in Uttarakhand's Khatima; shops set on fire
content: A fatal stabbing in Rudrapur has ignited violent protests, leading to police lathicharge and arson at the roadways bus station. Two men are detained as Hindu organizations express outrage over the death of Tushar Sharma. Authorities are scanning CCTV footage to apprehend more suspects involved in the incident, which police state stems from a long-standing rivalry, not communal tensions.

title: 'Mere apology not enough‚Äô: BJP targets Mamata over chaos at Messi event in Kolkata; demands legal action
content: The BJP has strongly criticized West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee following chaos at Salt Lake Stadium during Lionel Messi's visit. Leaders accused the state government of gross mismanagement, demanding accountability and punishment for those responsible. The incident saw fans protesting, leading to vandalism and a police baton charge, with many ticket holders unable to see the football star.

title: 2025: The year 'Chhaava', 'Saiyaara' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha' became Bollywood‚Äôs sequel slayers
content: Bollywood's 2025 box office saw a major shift. Original films like Chhaava, Saiyaara, and Mahavatar Narsimha triumphed over sequels. These movies delivered powerful stories and genuine emotion, resonating with audiences. This success signals a change, proving that strong content and audience connection are now more important than brand recall or franchise appeal.

title: HECI Bill likely to be introduced next week, standalone teacher training institutes may gain accreditation
content: The HECI Bill 2025, now renamed Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhikshan (VBSA) Bill, is set to be introduced in Parliament next week. The legislation will create a single regulator for higher education, replacing UGC, AICTE, and NCTE. Standalone teacher training institutes, previously outside accreditation frameworks, will now be evaluated under uniform standards. Aligned with NEP 2020, the bill aims to streamline regulation, accreditation, and learning outcomes across universities and colleges, providing consistency and a common benchmark.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle launches Canada-inspired Sports Club Atelier line
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of NHL star Connor McDavid, is launching a Canada-inspired collection for her brand, Sports Club Atelier, in January. Drawing inspiration from vintage winter advertising and alpine campaigns, the line features red-and-white pieces designed for fans to express patriotic pride fashionably at sporting events and in everyday life.

title: Israel eliminates top Hamas commander; video of targeted strike out
content: Israel's military announced the targeted killing of senior Hamas commander Raad Saad, a key planner of the October 7th attack. This strike, authorized by Prime Minister Netanyahu, retaliates for recent Israeli troop injuries. Saad, a long-time Hamas operative, held significant roles, including heading operations and weapons manufacturing, and had survived previous assassination attempts.

title: Canada shooting: 2 Punjabi youths killed while heading to party; probe underway
content: Two young Punjabi students, Gurdeep Singh (27) and Ranveer Singh (18), were tragically shot and killed in Edmonton, Canada, while en route to a party. The victims, both from Mansa district, were reportedly shot while in their car. Canadian police are investigating the incident and have apprehended several Punjabi youths.

title: 'Couldn‚Äôt step out': Woman gets trapped inside train toilet after 40 men storm coach in Bihar - watch
content: A woman's train journey turned terrifying at Katihar Junction when 30-40 men illegally boarded her reserved coach. Fearing for her safety, she locked herself in the toilet, sending an SOS. Railway Protection Force personnel swiftly intervened, clearing the unauthorized passengers and escorting her back. Vigilance has since been increased.

title: GOAT India Tour: The story of Lionel Messi's signed jersey in Kolkata ‚Äî exclusive
content: According to Mehtab Hossain, things began to spiral out of control when ‚Äúinfluential people‚Äù repeatedly breached security protocols to get close to Messi. Playing for Diamond Harbour was former India international Mehtab, for whom featuring on the occasion of an Argentine legend‚Äôs visit had become something of a ritual. He had earlier played a friendly match during Diego Armando Maradona‚Äôs visit to Kolkata in 2017.

title: Karnataka power tussle: Congress MLA says DKS will become CM next month
content: Congress MLA H A Iqbal Hussain predicted Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar will become Chief Minister on January 6 or 9, sparking political speculation. While Hussain strongly supports Shivakumar for the post, Shivakumar himself urged people not to take the MLA's remarks seriously, stating legal action might be necessary.

title: 'ISIS attack' on US troops: Trump vows 'very serious retaliation' ‚Äî what we know so far
content: Two American soldiers and a civilian interpreter died in a Syrian ambush. The attack near Palmyra was blamed on an Islamic State gunman. President Trump vowed severe retaliation. Syria's foreign minister condemned the violence. The attacker was killed by partner forces. This marks the first US casualties since the fall of the Assad regime.

title: Delhi chokes on ‚Äòsevere plus‚Äô AQI: Smog engulfs city, low visibility; key points
content: Delhi-NCR choked under severe toxic smog, with air quality hitting 491, the worst this year. Authorities invoked Stage IV GRAP, banning construction and restricting diesel trucks. Schools and offices adopted hybrid models. Experts cite emissions and weather for the crisis, urging emission cuts. Residents advised to stay indoors.

content: fantasy managers should consider starting Jauan Jennings in Week 15 . the playoffs already rolling in ESPN standard leagues and plenty of formats kicking off their tournaments this week . think big-play chops here and favorable deployment based on the week 15 slate of games .

title: Has trading for a superstar become too risky? League insiders examine the new normal
content: a five-team deal would send Anthony Davis to Atlanta and Trae Young to the Kings . the move came on the heels of a move to the san francisco in 2023 . a new owner hailed the creation of the next superteam .

title: College football bowl season: MVP picks for all 36 matchups
content: south Carolina State beat Prairie View A&M 40‚Äì38 with a two-point conversion and stop in quadruple overtime . it's one of the most exciting times of the year as the 2025 bowl season is underway . college football experts provide their MVP picks for each of the 36 bowl games this season .

title: MLB winter meetings winners, losers and head-scratching moves
content: the 2025 winter meetings didn't have a $700 million-plus deal like last year . but there were still a number of impactful free agent signings . veteran slugger Kyle Schwarber chose to return to the Philadelphia Phillies on a five-year deal in the first major splash of the meetings .

title: NHL trade grades: Report cards for Hughes, Jarry deals
content: the Vancouver Canucks traded Quinn Hughes to the Minnesota Wild in exchange for Zeev Buium , Marco Rossi , Liam Ohgren and a 2026 first-round pick . Throughout the season up until the March 6 deadline, ESPN reporters will be grading each side on all of the big swaps .

title: Patriots or Broncos: Breaking down the race for the AFC's No. 1 seed
content: the Denver Broncos and new England Patriots are separating from the pack in the race for the no. 1 seed . both enter this weekend with 11-2 records and are in the midst of 10-game winning streaks . payton recalls how his team was the No. 2 seed in the playoffs after the 2006 regular season .

title: Salah's farewell? If this was his final Liverpool chapter, he delivered a fitting end
content: Mohamed Salah's side beat Brighton 2-0 in the premier league . Salah overtook Wayne Rooney to claim the record for goal contributions by a player for a single club in the era . the 33-year-old could have added more gloss to that tally if he not spurned a glorious late opportunity .

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide.
